title: Hatched zones are very slow (lp:#1847764)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847764) created by **Mishka (mike-volokhov)**
```
Hi,

as I've mentioned in my another ticket, I'm trying to implement a flexible
PCB in KiCad. Recently I've switched to development branch because of the
hatched copper pour zones. Thank you very much for adding them to the
pcbnew!

However, the hatched zones are very slow. When instant refill of my zones
takes about a minute, export to Gerber files took it one hour and 30
minutes. At the same time, export with all zones set to solid takes
seconds.

Is it a known issue? Is there any way to improve this?

Thank you!

title: Hatched pour zones: solid areas for pads and vias (lp:#1847758)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847758) created by **Mishka (mike-volokhov)**
```
Hi,

I'm trying to implement a flexible PCB in KiCad. Recently I've switched to
development branch because of the hatched copper pour zones. Thank you very
much for adding them to the pcbnew!

One feature I miss though is solid area around pads and vias. Currently
pcbnew does good job by outlining perimeter of the fill area. However, in
case if hash lines are located far enough of each other the pad regions may
suffer from inconsistent and insufficient connection.

Also, it would be just wonderful if there will be an option to specify
width of the outline. Thus it will look like a thermal relief options, but
just doing the opposite job.

To show the issue please take a look to my schematic where pads 2, 3, 4,
and 5, as well as bunch of vias around are asking for solid areas.

Thanks!
```

title: Stray lines on hatched fill zones (lp:#1847737)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847737) created by **Mishka (mike-volokhov)**
```
Hi,

the GerbView shows stray lines within the area of hatched fill zones. This
depends on zone fill settings and happens when both of the following
occurs:

- hatch pattern orientation is not 0 degrees (I've tested on 30 and 45)
- hatch width equals to minimum zone fill width

This is how you can reproduce it:

1) create a copper zone
2) set the follwing parameters for the zone fill:
   Fill type: Hatch pattern
   Orientation: 45
   Hatch width: <same as Minimum width which is 0.254 mm by default)
   Hatch gap: <same as Hatch width, just for better visibility, i.e. 0.254
mm)
3) refill the zone
4) export it to Gerber
5) open the file in GerbView to observe the case

For your convenience I've attached PCB and Gerber samples.

I don't know though, is it pcbnew only or gerbview only issue. I've tried
number of online viewers and they display the Gerber file correctly. But at
the same time please note the issue depends on the pcbnew zone settings.

My version:

title: Pcbnew Gerber Export generates extra points in polygons (lp:#1847714)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847714) created by **St. Schulte (steven0815)**
```
Some CAM-processors stops plotting because at the end of some tracks there
is an additional point (duplicated). Example:

G36*
X133318815Y-95218815D02*
G01*
X133239463Y-95315506D01*
…
X132685000Y-95185000D01*
X133360019Y-95185000D01*
X133318815Y-95218815D01* <=
X133318815Y-95218815D01* <=
G37*
X133318815Y-95218815D02*

here is X133318815Y-95218815D01* doubled.

In the specs the generation is declared as:
Syntax              | Comments
G36*                | Start a region
X200Y300000D02*     | Move the current point to (2, 3)
G01*                | Set linear interpolation
X700000D01*         | Line segment to (7, 3)
Y100000D01*         | Line segment to (7, 1)
X1100000Y500000D01* | Line segment to (11, 5)
X700000Y900000D01*  | Line segment to (7, 9)
Y700000D01*         | Line segment to (7, 7)
X200000D01*         | Line segment to (2, 7)
Y300000D01*         | Line segment to (2, 3)
G37*                | Create the region by filling the contour

There is also a German thread about his (same data as above):
https://www.mikrocontroller.net/topic/482457

The data was created with KiCAD 5.1.4 (Windows and Linux), the errors were
visualized by GC-Prevue (white X in the CAM-Scfreenshot).
```

title: Wrong footprints in GenCAD export file (lp:#1847575)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847575) created by **Gerrit Telkamp (gerrit1)**
```
When the option "Generate a new shape for each footprint instance" in the
GenCAD export dialog is NOT ticked, the GenCAD file may contain wrong
footprint information for the components.
When this option is ticked (shapes are not reused), the GenCAD file is ok.
As workaround, we are generate GenCAD files where the footprints are not
reused.

Further information:
This problem can easily be reproduced using the "video" demo project
contained in the 5.1.4 release.
Please export a GenCAD file from this project without ticking the option,
so all footprints will be reused.
Component "R21" in the project is a 220R resistor in SMD 1206 package, but
in the GenCAD file it is referred as a resistor in R1812 package:

COMPONENT "R21"
DEVICE "DEV_Resistor_SMD:R_1812_4532Metric_Pad1.24x3.50mm_HandSolder"
PLACE 4.325 -2.66
LAYER BOTTOM
ROTATION 180
SHAPE "Resistor_SMD:R_1812_4532Metric_Pad1.24x3.50mm_HandSolder" MIRRORX
FLIP
TEXT 0 0.0807087 0.0393701 -0 MIRRORX SILKSCREEN_BOTTOM "R21" 0 0 0.11811
0.0393701
TEXT 0 -0.0807087 0.0393701 -0 MIRRORX SILKSCREEN_BOTTOM "220" 0 0 0.11811
0.0393701
SHEET "RefDes: R21, Value: 220"


Attached, there is a screenshot showing the relevant section of the PCB: on
the left sind, the GenCAD project imported with PCB Investigator, on the
right side in KiCAd. It is obvious that the footprints have a wrong size.
Forthermore, there seems to be something wrong with the left arc of X1, but
I have not tried to find out if KiCad or PCB investigator causes the
problem.


KiCad version:
Application: Pcbnew
Version: (5.1.4)-1, release build
Libraries:

    libcurl/7.61.1 OpenSSL/1.1.1 (WinSSL) zlib/1.2.11 brotli/1.0.6

title: Implement same-net clearance parameter (lp:#1847218)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847218) created by **Gerrit Telkamp (gerrit1)**
```
We're getting the feedback from our PCB manufacturer, saying that he found
“SameNetSpacing” issues in some filled copper zones of our KiCad project.
The filling algorithm seems to ignore the “min clearance” setting in some
situations. Please have a look to the screenshot I have uploaded to the
kicad forum:
https://kicad-info.s3.dualstack.us-
west-2.amazonaws.com/original/3X/3/7/37a1b457eca890be2f97d6353b78e27d9b44410a.png

* Case A: the distance between the two vias shown on the left is 1049um,
The filling algorithm generates two stubs having a distance of 48um. The
clearance setting was 152.4um (6mils)
* Case B: the distance between the two vias shown on the right is smaller:
880um. The distance between the two stubs is ok.
The annular ring and drill for all vias is exactly the same.
The "SameNetSpacing" issues can be solved if the vias are placed closer or
further.

Enclosed, there is a kicad project, demonstrating this behavour. When you
move the upper left GND via a bit closer or further to the other GND via
and refill layer In2, the distance between the two lobes will be ok - only
if this specific distance is used the problem will appear.

For further information, please have a look at the forum (also for
discuttion if "SameNetSpacing" should be handled as error or not):
https://forum.kicad.info/t/samenetspacing-issue-in-filled-copper-
zones/19273
```

title: Wishlist: Implementation of GIT and increase revision number (lp:#1847100)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1847100) created by **S2 (serkanxselcuk)**
```
Hello Developers,

Thank you for awesome work on KiCad.

I think it would be very helpful for PCB developers and KiCad librarian, if
KiCad would include some GIT features on Project editor, EEschema, PcbNew,
Symbol Editor, Footprint Editor and if applicable on GarberView.

Features would be active, if GIT is installed on system. If not installed,
inactive.
Features would like following:

- Show current branch [MOST HELPFUL]
     /mnt/DISC/myproject/myproject.pro (current_project_branch)
     /mnt/DISC/myproject/myproject.sch (current_project_branch)
     /mnt/DISC/myproject/myproject.pcb (current_project_branch)
     Symbol library (current_symbollib_branch)
     Footprint library (current_footprintlib_branch)
     GerberFileDirectory (current_project_branch)
- Show all branches on current repository (git branch -l)
- Change branch (git checkout ...)
- Split to new branch from current branch (git checkout -b ...)
- Add files/changes and commit (git add ... , git commit -m "...")
- Tag revision field (Rev) on commit, if revision is changed. (git tag
"...")
- push/pull (git pull , git push , git push --tags)
- Display status (git status)
- button for gitk (gitk --all)

It would also be nice, if last numeric characters of revision field "Rev"
increase automaticaly on save. i.e. "v02.004" -> "v02.005", "v29" -> "v30"
, "v99" -> "v100"

Thank you very much for your effort and success.
```

description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1846811) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
Not bug, but suggestion.
I think it would be useful if thermal relief spoke width could be settable
not only at pad level but also at whole footprint level (or maybe at
footprint class level).
In footprint libraries probably all footprints has this width set to 0 for
all pads. So user probably sets it after placing zones at PCB.

GND zone connects to many 0402 blocking capacitors so for zone I set spoke
width to 0.25mm.
But, among others, I have also 2x20 pin connector in which I assumed GND-
Signal1-Signal2-GND-Signal3... to each signal have adjacent GND return
path.
I have to change spoke width for each GND pad. I found that I can copy-
paste pad properties but it would be easier if:
- I could select all pads inside footprint by mouse rectangle, or
- just set it for whole footprint.

Writing this I got idea how I will solve that. I will modify that width in
my footprint definitions.

May be in KiCad default libraries all bigger elements should have the spoke
width defined.

between eeschema and pcbnew. In the identical hierarchical drawings "LED"
on sheet T2.sch is in each case a part of a multi-part IC (here 74AUC2G00).
Now the netlist visible in pcbnew:

sheet5D88809D show the two related parts of U2. Port "P0" associated with

component R3 from "Led 0". The connection "P3" has disappeared.

title: Changing Footprint (lp:#1846488)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1846488) created by **Peter Jenkins (peter-rtd)**
```
Created design schematic. Moved between schematic and PCB  NEW several
times. Eventually got message that the .NET file could not be used as two
ICs had footprints could not be used as pins were missing. On checking  the
schematic I found that the two ICs had SOIC 16 footprints declared (as I
expected), however PCBNEW considered that SOIC14 had been declared for
both.

In the schematic I re-selected SOIC16 for both. No success. Also I deleted
the .NET file then re-created it. No success.

Other ICs were in the schematic but were not affected.

Previously a schematic with a collection of 14, 16 and  18 pin SOIC ICs had
all changing to 8 pin SOIC after schematic editing.

Am I doing something wrong, or is there a fault?

Peter

When you try to create a zone that is constrained to H/V/45 from the start,

linux/9/../../../../include/c++/9/bits/stl_vector.h:1060:

title: eeschema undo: corrupted schematic when undoing hierarchical pin operations (lp:#1846247)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1846247) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
When undoing some operations on hierarchical pin of a sheet, some lines
from buses from another page appear on the sheet then, exiting eeschema it
segfaults.

To reproduce:
-Open the attached project.
-"Import a hierarchical sheet pin" from the sheet in the main page, import
all five of them.
-Undo once. See the whole sheet when undoing: some bus lines appear (in the
same position as they hare in the child sheet).

May be is related to bug Bug #1844620, where the problem was also on the
undo system, but this is just an hypothesis.

Tested on master branch, commit d17cef95fde0318dd6b8694dfff2c1bb6449e125.

Stable version seems to not have the issue (tested on 5.1.2 and 5.1.4)

I've seen this issue also some months ago, but I was not able to reproduce
it in a deterministic way, but on this project seems to be deterministic
(on my machine).

title: Hotkeys I and U don't work if one track is selected. (lp:#1845781)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1845781) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
When you select a track by using hotkey I or U (or context menu - Select
submenu) then you can not extend selection to next track by using that
hotkeys. Context menu "Select - Connected Tracks" is active but not works.
As having many tracks being selected is not forbidden then I think
selecting one after another by using key I (or U) should be possible.
I have tried to use that keys with Shift key (typically used to extend
selection) but it don't helps.
I think I and U keys should allow for as many tracks selections as you have
at your PCB.
May be it would be worth of considering to make them working as toggle (if
when selecting track after track you, by mistake, selected one you didn't
wonted).

I have also noticed that if you have any footprint selected than functions
in submenu Select (in context menu) are not active. As you can have
selected at the same moment the footprints and tracks then I don't see
rationale to make these submenus inactive.

description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1845460) created by **Novak Tamas (novak-7)**
```
When I manually solder, I open pcbnew, Ctrl-F Find, enter value e.g. "4k7",

component, further Enter strikes do nothing.

again through all components.

scroll through the components in X,Y location order.

title: PCBnew: Specify Soldermask material and dielectric in stack up manager (lp:#1845108)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1845108) created by **Victor W (vicw)**
```
I'm using the latest version of the PCBnew, and the new stack up manager
looks amazing.

I have one request; we're building a signal critical front end board, and
need to specify the Dk/Df of the solder mask layer.

Is it possible to allow users to also specify the solder mask material, and
it's associated Dk/Df?

We have a design which requires a specific soldermask due to a combination
of environmental requirements, soldermask dam size requirements, and also
really critical RF specifications. There are a couple of options, but we've
settled on one, and it would be nice to be able to communicate that to fab.

Would it be possible to add the ability to specify the "material",
"Thickness", "Colour", and Er/Loss tangent for the silk layer?

Also, thank you so much for this feature. It's really, really, useful.
```

title: Wish: make high contrast mode "background elements" colour configurable or dependent on background colour (lp:#1845026)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1845026) created by **Rene Poeschl (poeschlr)**
```
If one increases the background lightness to a dark gray (example lightness
value 50) then the (seemingly) hardcoded high contrast background elements
colour is near invisible.

It would be nice if either the high contrast background elements colour is
made dependent on the current background colour (example a certain distance
in lightness from higher than it until the background reaches some point
then it is darker than the background) or possibly better make it user
setable.

An example that does not work is the blue-green-dark scheme from
https://github.com/pointhi/kicad-color-schemes (the dark grey is much
easier on my eyes compared to pure black)
```

title: Setting Canvas Scale to > 1 messes up 3DViewer rotation center
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1844857) created by **Romain (romain145)**
```
KiCAD is displayed in very small characters on High DPI 4k screen.

To have it displayed at a usable scaling, here is the workaround:
Open the app you want to enhance scaling.
Right-click the app in the taskbar.
Right-click the name of the app and select Properties.
Quick Tip: You can also find the app's .exe file, right-click it, and
select Properties.
Click the Compatibility tab.
Under "Settings," check the Override high DPI scaling behavior option.
Under "Scaling performed by" drop-down menu, select System (Enhanced).

title: Connecting pads by ones origin inside the second one don't work. (lp:#1844661)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1844661) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
From https://bugs.launchpad.net/kicad/+bug/1843993 message #3 I understood
that smd offsets were introduced to allow connecting two pads by
positioning origin of one of them inside the second one.
That doesn't work in 5.1.4 stable.
The KEY10.kicad_mod (attached) is designed that way. Top pad1 I left
without offset, but all others smd pads use offsets to have their origin in
top pad1, or pad already connected that way with top pad1.
When I put that footprint at PCB (project attached) I see pads not being
connected and connection lines pointing the pad graphic centers and not
their origins.
Compare KEY_1.png and KEY_2.png. When I connect track to right pad 1 origin
two connection lines disappear. At first I supposed that at that moment
they were found to be connected (thanks to my offsets) but now I think that
both of them are found to be connected to track so they are connected also.

I supposed connection lines would point to pad origins. And I think it
should work that way (if not then what for are the offsets in smd pads).
But what if someone use both X and Y offset and position origin out of pad.
First thought is to not allow it in footprint editor. But in my footprint
would't it be logical to position all pad 2 origins in center of through-
hole pad 2 making them being connected and at once making the connection
line to point where the connection is expected to be done.

title: eeschema: "highlight wires and pins of a net" on /<NO NET> highlights different nets (lp:#1844624)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1844624) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
On Master branch,
 When different nets have not been named yet (as when a schematic has not
been annotated and the nets have not been named), using the highlight tool
can give wrong result: different nets have the same name (/<NO NET>) and
they are highlighted even if they are not connected.

Since "no information" is better than "wrong information", a simple
solution could be to not highlight the wires if the net name is "/<NO NET>"
(and issue a warning).

To reproduce:
1) Open a generic schematic (without net labels)
2) Clear annotation
3) Highlight a net: all nets get highlighted since all net names are "/<NO
NET>"

In stable version 5.1.4 there is not this behaviour: it seems the nets are
always named (Something like Net-(R?1753720092-Pad2)) even if the schematic
has not been annotated, so there is no risk to see different un-connected
nets highlighted at the same time..

Cheers,
Dino.

title: eeschema undo: missing junctions when undoing delete. (lp:#1844620)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1844620) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
Undo in eeschema (master branch) does not always work correctly.

To reproduce:
1) Select a block with some junctions.
2) Delete it (del key)
3) undo (ctrl-z).
   The un-done deleted part now does not have some of the junction symbols.

Attached there is a simple project to show the behaviour.

(See the attached images for the before-after the delete+undo operation).

Dragging the wires make the junctions on the dragged part re-appear, so it
seems that the wire is connected but without the junction symbol.

I also had a (probably) related issue on undoing operations on much more
complex schematics, where also bus segments appear like they were copied
from somewhere else, but that is quite erratic and I did not find (yet) a
way to reproduce that in a deterministic (and simple) way.


Note: Stable version 5.1.4 works correctly.

Cheers, Dino.

==

title: wishlist: pcbnew net class: (automatic?) import of trace width/via from net classes definition to "tracks and vias" (lp:#1844321)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1844321) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
When a net class is defined in Board setup->Design Rules->Net Classes, the
track dimensions and via type(size, drill) are not imported automatically
in Defaults->Track and vias.

A way to add (semi)automatically those trace width, via type to the default
track and vias  (just to have them added to the "W" - "shift+W" sequence
for routing) could make the board setup a little bit faster than using
copy/paste for the values.

Automatically adding all the width/drill sizes probably is not the optimum
since when importing the settings from another project may be not all the
existing net classes are needed in current project, but also a way do tho
this manually can be an improvement.

A possible solution could be right-clicking the row and having a pop-up
menu item added with "import into Defaults track/via"
Another solution, more "atomic" could be right-click a cell where we have a
track width and have "import track width into board defaults" (or a better
and shorter function name) to import just that trace width (or via size).

Cheers, Dino.

-----------------------------------------------------

title: Unable to open edit dialog at all when "edit changes track width" is active (lp:#1844023)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1844023) created by **Ian McInerney (imcinerney)**
```
When the "edit changes track width" is selected in preferences, it also
makes it so the properties context menu item changes the track width
instead of opening the properties window. This means that there is no way
of actually editing a trace's properties when that option is activated.

It seems that the context menu action should not be overridden by the
preference, so that action is only modified when using the keyboard. That
way you could still open the edit window to change other properties about
the trace without having to go into preferences and change the option.

title: Use environment variable that remove the most folders in path normalization (lp:#1843994)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1843994) created by **Karl Zeilhofer (zeilhofer)**
```
Hi,

it seems, that we have found a bug, how KiCad's footprint editor replaces
given paths with environment variables.

Let's assume this variables:

FOOTPRINTS -> /footprints
3D_MODELS -> /footprints/packages3d

If now a footprint is edited, and the 3d model is changed to e.g.

/footprints/packages3d/Diode_SMD.3dshapes/D_SMA.step
, then KiCad replaces this path by

${FOOTPRINTS}/packages3d/Diode_SMD.3dshapes/D_SMA.step

instead of the simpler form:

${3D_MODELS}/Diode_SMD.3dshapes/D_SMA.step
(note the skipped '/packages3d` here).

With a single user setup, this is no problem at all. But with a multi user
setup, where each user has set up proper environment variables, but not
necessarily nested, this leads to missing 3D models, if the 2nd user has
not his 3D models within the path of ${FOOTPRINTS}/packages3d .

Please let me know, if this is intended behaviour, or if this is a bug. I
hope this is a bug. If not, all users are forced to put their 3d-models
within the path of the footprints.

KiCad's official libraries on Github do not show such a nested folder
structure, but a default installation on Windows does.

This bug was discovered with KiCad V5.1.2 on Windows.

Kind regards, Karl
```

title: Why not allow pad holes being bigger then pad? (lp:#1843989)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1843989) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
It is not a bug, and even not a wish. It is the suggestion to consider
changing some assumptions.

I fill no comfortable with drill size equal to pad size for NPTH. Having in
mind that drills positioning has a finite precision I imagine a moon-like
copper can be left on the board.
Since 'always' I was using much smaller pads then drill sizes for NPTHs.

Seeing I can't define drill size bigger then pad size I supposed that KiCad
when generating gerbers masks copper layers with drills. But at Thursday I
generated gerbers of my first V5 PCB and noticed that it is not masked.

I believe precision KiCad version is not needed here.
```

title: Delete file in project tree should move to trash [waiting on wxWidgets] (lp:#1843781)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1843781) created by **Seth Hillbrand (sethh)**
```
When choosing the "Delete" option from the project tree, the file will be
unlinked and removed from the filesystem with no option to recover if it
was mistakenly removed.  This is contrary to expected behavior for a
filesystem action.

wxWidgets does not support the "send to trash" action natively, so this
would likely be a porting task from similar features in other GPL-
compatible applications.

c.f. https://github.com/hsoft/send2trash

Alternatively, we could create a .Trash folder in the project tree itself
where deleted files go

title: pcbnew action plugin can crash kicad (lp:#1843700)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1843700) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
In master branch a python script can crash pcbnew.

Tested with ReplicateLayout plugin from

https://github.com/MitjaNemec/Kicad_action_plugins

To replicate it:

-Install the replicateLayout plugin
-Open the attached project
-Open pcbnew
-Select R15
-Tools->External Plugins->Replicate Layout
-in the dialog in "Hierarchy level select file5D...FA.sch
-Click OK
-Now the layout seems correctly replicated but exiting pcbnew (don't save)
there is a segfault.
If, after running the script you try to undo it with ctrl-z you can get
some other weird behaviour (like some new components without any label and
not selectable on the board).


On 5.1.2 and 5.1.4 stable versions the script seems to work correctly
(although it needed some modifications since the "Flip" function in dev
version gets 3 arguments and in stable it did get two. May be overloading
it with the old behaviour can help in not braking old scripts when V6 will
be released)

Position:   X: [_______]  Y: [_______] mm

Cheers,
